availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George F. Tuttle (Essex County, New Jersey, attorney)

body.p: Essex County, New Jersey, lawyer. Essex County, New Jersey, native. Married to Elizabeth Mills Tuttle. Father of Rosa Ellen Tuttle, Joseph N. Tuttle, and George S. Tuttle. Attorney in Newark, New Jersey, in 1850. Attorney in Newark in 1860. Master in Chancery of New Jersey in Essex County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, New Jersey, Essex County, Newark East Ward, p. 145A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, New Jersey, Essex County, Newark Ward 4, p. 509.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, New Jersey, Essex County, Newark, p. 263.
Thirteenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1910), Population Schedules, New Jersey, Essex County, Newark Ward 4, p. 17.
The Ryerson Genealogy: Genealogy and History of the Knickerbocker Families of Ryerson, Ryerse, Rye, ed. Alfred L. Holman (Chicago: Edward L. Ryerson, 1910), 66.
William H. Shaw, History of Essex and Hudson Counties, New Jersey, vol. 1 (Philadelphia: Everts & Peck, 1884), 284.
KYR-0001-017-0131.
